```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
library(gamma)
library(magrittr)
```

## Import files
```{r import, fig.width=7, fig.height=5, fig.align="center"}
# Import CNF files for calibration
cnf_cerege <- system.file("extdata/cerege/", package = "gamma")
spc_cerege <- read(cnf_cerege)
spc_cerege

# Select 'BRIQUE', 'C341', 'C347', 'GOU' and 'PEB' spectra to build the curve
spc_calib <- spc_cerege[c("BRIQUE", "C341", "C347", "GOU", "PEP")]
# Select 'PB' spectra for background measurement
spc_noise <- spc_cerege[["PB"]]

# Plot spectra
plot(spc_calib) +
  ggplot2::geom_vline(xintercept = c(238, 1461, 2614.5), linetype = 3) +
  ggplot2::labs(x = "Energy [keV]", y = "Counts") +
  ggplot2::theme_bw()
```

## Check automatic peak detection
```{r peak}
# Remove base line
spc_clean <- removeBaseline(spc_calib)

# Fit peaks
spc_fit <- lapply(X = spc_clean, FUN = fitPeaks, peaks = c(238, 1461, 2614.5))
```

```{r peak-fit, fig.width=7, fig.height=5, fig.align="center", results="asis"}
# Visual inspection
expected_peaks <- c(238, 1461, 2614.5)

for (i in 1:length(spc_fit)) {
  print(
    plot(spc_fit[[i]]) +
      ggplot2::labs(title = spc_fit[[i]][["spectrum"]][["reference"]], 
                    x = "Energy [keV]", y = "Counts") +
      ggplot2::theme_bw()
  )
  
  pks_sumup <- spc_fit[[i]][["peaks"]] %>%
      dplyr::mutate(shift = (energy - expected_peaks) * 100 / expected_peaks)
  print(
    knitr::kable(
      pks_sumup,
      digits = 3,
      col.names = c("Chanel", "Energy [keV]", "Count", 
                    "Count rate [1/s]", "Energy shift [%]"),
      caption = spc_fit[[i]][["spectrum"]][["reference"]]
    )
  )
  cat('\n')
}
```

## Check energy shift
```{r adjust, fig.width=7, fig.height=5, fig.align="center"}
spc_adjust <- calibrateEnergy(spc_calib, peaks = c(238, 1461, 2614.5))

plot(spc_adjust) +
  ggplot2::geom_vline(xintercept = c(238, 1461, 2614.5), linetype = 3) +
  ggplot2::labs(x = "Energy [keV]", y = "Count") +
  ggplot2::theme_bw()
```

## Build Calibration curve
```{r calibration, fig.width=5, fig.height=5, fig.align="center"}
# Calibrate energy scale
calib_scale <- calibrateEnergy(spc_calib)

# Build calibration curve
known_dose <- list(
  BRIQUE = c(1984.64, 34.08),
  C347 = c(1421.38, 25.25),
  C341 = c(849.01, 21.32),
  PEP = c(2535.53, 112.17),
  GOU = c(1573.41, 17.43)
)

CEREGE <- calibrateDose(
  calib_scale,
  dose = known_dose,
  noise = list(value = 1190, error = 1)
)
CEREGE

# Plot Calibration curve
plot(CEREGE) +
  ggplot2::labs(x = "Dose rate [ÂµGy/y]", y = "Signal") +
  ggplot2::theme_bw()
```

```{r save, eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE}
usethis::use_data(CEREGE, overwrite = FALSE)
```
